ygData.msgSnippet: SailChallenge now has animation that shows the sailboat traveling around the island. This is by means of a Python program that invokes the compiled C program,

Subject: ANNEvolve releases SailChallenge-2.0
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=104426122; y=6hwDFvXMfKQOcNPHi-QXmiQIatJRUzPvTrHJfeE-g7CP5giJ
X-Yahoo-Profile: zenguyuno

SailChallenge now has animation that shows the sailboat traveling around the island. 
This is by means of a Python program that invokes the compiled C program, and captures
its output.  The Python program uses the captured output to create the animation.

SailChallenge consists of a physics model and a controller function which create a
virtual sailboat and a virtual yachtsman.  The "yachtsman" sets the sails and rudder and
the model moves the boat accordingly.  This is updated in small time steps to create a
trajectory.

The purpose of SailChallenge is to invite others to create their own version of the
controller function and compare its performance to ours.  Our virtual yachtsman is an
ANN that is the result of neuroevolution.  You are welcome to create your own, using
NEAT, or any technology of your choice.

SailChallenge-2.0 also contains an alternate controller function which does not use an
ANN.  It is a hand-coded sailboat controller which attempts to crudely simulate the
decisions of a human yachtsman. 

Ample documentation is include in the downloadable package.  It will run on Windows or
linux systems.  Python is required; this is a free download from python.org.

There is a screenshot on our website.




Mitchell Timin

I'm proud of http://ANNEvolve.sourceforge.net.  I'm currently working on a major update of the SailChallenge package.  If you want to write software, or articles, or do testing for ANNEvolve, let me know.
